revision.comment: M3 Gun Motor Carriage Passed A class review
revision.text:
{{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory | action1 = GAN | action1date = 01:22, 19 December 2015 (UTC) | action1link = Talk:M3 Gun Motor Carriage/GA1 | action1result = listed | action1oldid = 695839791 |dykdate=11 January 2016 |dykentry= ... that it is claimed that 36 '''[[M3 Gun Motor Carriage|M3 Gun Motor Carriages]]''' destroyed 30 German tanks, including 2 [[Tiger I|Tiger]] tanks, at the [[Battle of El Guettar]] in March 1943? | currentstatus = GA | topic = Warfare
|action2=WAR |action2date=10:07, 10 April 2016 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/M3 Gun Motor Carriage |action2result=approved |action2oldid=714496046 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{MILHIST|class=A|b1=y|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y|A-Class=pass|US=y|Weaponry=y|WWII=y|British=y|French=y}} }}
==Image== I'm pretty sure the vehicle on the image [[:Image:75mm M3 GMC.jpg]] carries 105mm howitzer, which makes it 105mm HMC T19. Note different gun recoil system and shield: http://images.google.com/images?hl=en&q=T19+105mm+HMC&btnG=Search+Images and http://images.google.com/images?hl=en&q=M3+75mm+GMC&btnG=Search+Images. [[User:Bukvoed|Bukvoed]] 08:36, 17 February 2007 (UTC)
* Believe you are correct. I'm removing the image until I can get something better. The *png of the TD force insignia will have to serve as the sole image until then. Thanks for pointing that out. [[User:W. B. Wilson|W. B. Wilson]] 10:10, 17 February 2007 (UTC)
* Done - correct image now loaded. [[User:W. B. Wilson|W. B. Wilson]] 10:48, 17 February 2007 (UTC)
==Name==
Unsure how to change it, but the title of the page says "M3 Gun Mortar Carriage". Should read "M3 Gun Motor Carriage". Suggest this be changed. - [[User:SquireJames|SquireJames]] 17:43, 07 August 2011 (GMT)
== Okinawa? ==
Perhaps the author(s) of the article confused, at least chronologically, Okinawa with Iwo Jima because I have read several sources that explicitly state that the M3 was replaced after Iwo by the M7 and it was the M7 that saw its first use by the Marines on Okinawa.--[[Special:Contributions/172.190.48.160|172.190.48.160]] ([[User talk:172.190.48.160|talk]]) 05:25, 26 July 2012 (UTC)
